tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Made 10 birdies and no bogeys over the final 29 holes to share runner-up honors at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Q-School in Lima, Peru in January... Had one top-10 and six top-25s in 11 starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, where he finished the year ranked 54th on the Order of Merit… Made his Latinoamérica Tour debut with consecutive top-20s at the 68th Avianca Colombia Open (T13) and Mazatlán Open (T17)... Had three consecutive top-15s in September, including a season best T6 at the Aberto do Brasil in Rio de Janeiro… Made the cut in three of four Web.com Tour starts, with a T23 finish at the Albertsons Boise Open as his best... Finished T93 at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December.

2014: Shot 68-67-69 to win the Golden State Tour's Carlton Oaks Shootout by six strokes in August. That was his first career win on his first month as a pro… Shot 5-over to miss the 54-hole cut at the European Tour's Alfred Dunhill Championship in Scotland in October.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Enjoyed a solid career at Cal State Fullerton, where was named to the Big West Conference First Team three consecutive years… Collected nine top-3s in 12 starts during his senior year, including two individual wins at the 2013 Warrior Princeville Makai Invite and the 2014 Folino Invitational… Named 2014 PING All-Region West Team… Won the 2014 Sahalee Players Championship in July after completing his studies at Cal State… A four-year varsity letterman at La Serna High School in Whittier, California, where he was his team's co-captain as a junior and senior... Won the 2008 Southern California Junior PGA League Championship, metro section 14-15 years.
tourBios.personal: Biggest thrill in golf was making a double eagle on the fourth sudden-death playoff hole to Monday qualify for the Albertsons Boise Open in 2015, his first Web.com Tour event, also playing in the European Tour's Alfred Dunhill Links Championship in 2014 was the quite the experience. Remembers getting chills as his name was called on the first tee…Was a bass guitarist in a rock band in high school and college and played in small venues around Orange County, Calif…Earliest golf memory was playing golf with his father and uncle at Fullerton Golf Course…Worked at his parents' meat/grocery market towards the end of high school and early on in college…Entrance song on the first tee would be "Hysteria" by Muse…Would like to be the President of the United States for a day…Always keeps four tees in his right pocket at all times and marks his ball with a coin heads up…Grew seven inches from freshman to sophomore year of high school…Currently in the process of starting up "Links for Life" with his golf coach. The goal is to help kids whose families are less fortunate and give children in the Los Angeles and San Diego areas a chance to enjoy the game of golf…List driving up the freeway on the coast of California on his bucket list…Older brother, Ryan, built a computer by himself when he was 5-years-old… Twitter name is @angweeee… Instagram name is @markanguiano

tourBios.exmtStatus: Finished T93 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri in 2016 is T9th at the Guatemala Stella Artois Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T64th in Total Eagles on the Latinoamérica.
